instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b restarts when u press power buttun
threads.message:
Hi all,

Thiis is liquid damaged board damaged SMC area. Earlier Green light no power. After replacing <RESISTOR>R5173</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5192</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R1802</RESISTOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5013</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5011</CAPACITOR> , power up booting normally. only issue is when u shutdown cant start with the power buttun. Or if you try to power off before booting pressing the power buttun it reboots. <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>  is 3.3v. <RESISTOR>R1802</RESISTOR> both side 3.3v present.

Any idea where to check..?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b restarts when u press power buttun
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> going low if you press the power button. Could also very well be crap under the SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b restarts when u press power buttun
threads.message: Hi Duke, Just to let you know that this was solved after reballing SMC. Thank you so much for your support.
